description: Ms. codex. Title from leaf 1b, lines 11-12. Physical description: 18 lines per page; written in neat naskh in black on glazed, laid Arabic paper. Rubrication and catchwords; extensive marginal and interlinear notes. Leaves 110-113, 119, 212-214 are replacements. Marginal damp staining and some paper repairs, particularly to first few leaves. Origin: Likely 17th century. Incipit: الحمد لله المتفرد بالقدم والدوام المتنزه عن مشابهة الاعراض والاجسام
author: Ibn al-Muṭahhar al-Ḥillī, al-Ḥasan ibn Yūsuf, 1250-1325
extent: 214 leaves : paper ; 245 x 120 (165 x 63) mm bound to 254 x 131 mm
creator: Ibn al-Muṭahhar al-Ḥillī, al-Ḥasan ibn Yūsuf, 1250-1325
ابن المطهر الحلي، الحسن بن يوسف، 1250-1325
subject: Islamic law—Interpretation and construction—Early works to 1800
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
